conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux through the coil as it rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
Initial magnetic flux calculation using Φ = B * A * cos(θ) with θ = 0°.
Initial angle θ = 0° because the magnetic field is parallel to the x-axis and the normal to the plane of the coil is also along the x-axis.
Final magnetic flux calculation after rotating the coil by 60° downward, θ = 60°.
Calculate Φ_final = 0.1 T * 0.4 m² * cos(60°) = 0.02 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial.
The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is -0.02 Wb.
